str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Many times, often, frequently. Multiplicative adverb from polus; many times, i.e. Frequently.

parse: Verb - Perfect Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.
A shackle, fetter for the feet. Ultimately from pous; a shackle for the feet.

parse: Verb - Perfect Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To tear apart, burst. From dia and spao; to draw apart, i.e. Sever or dismember.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.

parse: Verb - Perfect Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From sun and the base of tribos; to crush completely, i.e. To shatter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A shackle, fetter for the feet. Ultimately from pous; a shackle for the feet.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
To tame, subdue, involving obedience and restraint. A variation of an obsolete primary of the same meaning; to tame.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
